'''12 April 2011''': Hosni Mubarak, the former Egyptian president, has been questioned in hospital by prosecutors at the Red Sea port of Sharm el-Sheikh, where he has been staying since he was ousted from power by a popular uprising on February 11.<ref>http://english.aljazeera.net/news/middleeast/2011/04/201141216755944186.html</ref>
+

'''13 April 2011''': Egyptâs Prosecutor General has ordered the detention 15 days of the Egyptian former president and his two children , [[Alaa Mubarak]] and [[Gamal Mubarak]], has officially informed. A statement from the Attorney General Egyptian published on its website on Facebook, the arrest warrant was issued after the prosecution presented the charges against them and in accordance with the development of the criminal investigations around the rioting that led to the fall of the regime.<ref>{{cite web|author=Mark Gregory |url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-13058855 |title=BBC News â Egypt: Mubarak and sons detained amid corruption probe |publisher=Bbc.co.uk |date= |accessdate=2011-04-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/mubarak-and-sons-ordered-detained-for-corruption-probe-egypts-state-television-says/2011/04/13/AFQFifUD_story.html |title=Egypt detains Mubarak and family in probe on wealth and crackdown on protests |publisher=[[Washington Post]] |date=2011-04-13 |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
+
'''13 April 2011''': Egyptâs Prosecutor General has ordered the detention 15 days of the Egyptian former president and his two children , [[Alaa Mubarak]] and [[Gamal Mubarak]], has officially informed. '''25 April 2011''': A poll released by the Pew Global Attitudes Project shows Egyptians are deeply skeptical about the United States and its role in their country, but they are also divided in their attitudes about Islamic fundamentalists. Most Egyptians distrust the United States and want to renegotiate their peace treaty with Israel, the poll found.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/world/poll-egyptians-have-unfavorable-view-of-us-are-divided-on-fundamentalists/2011/04/25/AFxCzFjE_story.html |title=Poll: Egyptians have unfavorable view of U.S., are divided on fundamentalists |publisher=[[Washington Post]] |date=2011-04-25 |accessdate=2011-05-22}}</ref>
+

Line 274: Line 274:
Hundreds of thousands of demonstrators -yet again- filled Tahrir Square in Egypt's capital [[Cairo]], besides tens of thousands in each of Alexandra, Suez, Ismailia, Gharbeya and other areas; in the largest demonstrations since ousting Mubarak's Regime.
Hundreds of thousands of demonstrators -yet again- filled Tahrir Square in Egypt's capital [[Cairo]], besides tens of thousands in each of Alexandra, Suez, Ismailia, Gharbeya and other areas; in the largest demonstrations since ousting Mubarak's Regime.
â
'''28 May 2011''': Former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak has been fined $34m (Â£20m) for cutting off communications services during the uprising that ousted him.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13585237|title=Egypt: Hosni Mubarak fined for cutting internet|date=28 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref> Egypt eases blockade at Gaza's Rafah border. Women, children and men over 40 are allowed to pass freely. Men aged between 18 and 40 will still require a permit, and trade is prohibited. The crossing will now be open from 0900 to 2100 every day except Fridays and holidays. The move - strongly opposed by Israel - comes some three months after Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak lost power. Egypt and Israel closed borders with Gaza when Hamas seized power in 2007. Since then almost all Palestinians have been confined to the narrow territory.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13581141|title=Egypt eases blockade at Gaza's Rafah border|date=28 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref> <ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13584339|title=In pictures: Egypt-Gaza border opens at Rafah|date=28 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13240113|title=Gaza-Egypt border crossing to open permanently|date=29 April 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13552685|title=Gaza: Egypt 'to open Rafah crossing to Palestinians|date=25 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref>
+
'''28 May 2011''': Former Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak has been fined $34m (Â£20m) for cutting off communications services during the uprising that ousted him.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13585237|title=Egypt: Hosni Mubarak fined for cutting internet|date=28 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref> Egypt eases blockade at Gaza's Rafah border. Women, children and men over 40 are allowed to pass freely. Men aged between 18 and 40 will still require a permit, and trade is prohibited. The crossing will now be open from 0900 to 2100 every day except Fridays and holidays. The move - strongly opposed by Israel - comes some three months after Egyptian President Hosni Mubarak lost power. Egypt and Israel closed borders with Gaza when Hamas seized power in 2007. Since then almost all Palestinians have been confined to the narrow territory.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13581141|title=Egypt eases blockade at Gaza's Rafah border|date=28 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13584339|title=In pictures: Egypt-Gaza border opens at Rafah|date=28 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13240113|title=Gaza-Egypt border crossing to open permanently|date=29 April 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-middle-east-13552685|title=Gaza: Egypt 'to open Rafah crossing to Palestinians|date=25 May 2011|publisher=BBC News|accessdate=29 May 2011}}</ref>
